# List of National Basketball Association single-game steals leaders

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to navigation Jump to search

This is a complete listing of [National Basketball
Association](/wiki/National_Basketball_Association "National Basketball
Association") players who have recorded nine or more
[steals](/wiki/Steal_\(basketball\) "Steal \(basketball\)") in a game.

51 different players have recorded nine or more steals in a game. It has
occurred 72 times in total in NBA history.

[Allen Iverson](/wiki/Allen_Iverson "Allen Iverson") is the only player to
record nine or more steals in a playoff game.

The NBA did not record steals until the [1973–74
season](/wiki/1973%E2%80%9374_NBA_season "1973–74 NBA season").

game_steals_leaders&action=edit&section=2 "Edit section: Notes")]

  1. **Jump up ^** Kendall Gill had quarterly steals of 0, 5, 3 and 3. He had no steals in the first quarter.
  2. **Jump up ^** Jerry West had 6 steals in the first half and 4 steals in the second half.
  3. **Jump up ^** Larry Steele barely missed a quadruple-double, by one assist.
  4. **Jump up ^** Fred Brown had 8 steals in a half, tying the NBA record.
  5. **Jump up ^** This was the second game of a double header, which was only the second double header in NBA history.
  6. **Jump up ^** Fat Lever had 8 steals in the third quarter, setting the NBA record. He had 8 steals in the second half, tying the NBA record.
  7. **Jump up ^** Clyde Drexler barely missed a quadruple-double, by one rebound.
  8. **Jump up ^** Alvin Robertson achieved the second [quadruple-double](/wiki/Quadruple-double "Quadruple-double") in NBA history. It is the only NBA quadruple-double with steals as one of the four statistics in double figures.
  9. **Jump up ^** Ron Harper established the rookie single-game record. He had five steals in each half.
  10. **Jump up ^** Michael Jordan had 6 steals within the third quarter. He left the game early due to the Bulls' comfortable lead.
  11. **Jump up ^** The game went to overtime.
  12. **Jump up ^** Clyde Drexler had 8 steals in the second half, tying the NBA record. It was the first game of the season, marking the most steals in a season opener. For a second time in his career, Drexler barely missed a quadruple-double, this time by one assist.
  13. **Jump up ^** Allen Iverson had quarterly steals of 3, 3, 3 and 1.
  14. **Jump up ^** Michael Finley had 8 steals in the first half, tying the NBA record. He had 5 steals in the first quarter.
  15. **Jump up ^** First player in NBA history to record 10 steals and 5 blocks in one game.
  16. **Jump up ^** First player in NBA history to record 30 points, 10 steals, and 7 assists in a game since steals became a recorded stat.
  17. **Jump up ^** Rick Barry barely missed a quadruple-double, by one steal.
  18. **Jump up ^** Slick Watts fouled out of the game.
  19. **Jump up ^** Quinn Buckner was a rookie. The Bucks combined for 21 steals.
  20. **Jump up ^** Gus Williams had 8 steals in the second half, tying the NBA record.
  21. **Jump up ^** Ron Lee shot 6–12 from three-point range, tying the NBA record for three-point attempts at the time.
  22. **Jump up ^** Dudley Bradley had eight steals in the second half, tying the NBA record. He had six steals in the fourth quarter.
  23. **Jump up ^** Dudley Bradley had five steals in the fourth quarter.
  24. **Jump up ^** Magic Johnson had five steals in a half and four steals in the other half.
  25. **Jump up ^** The game went to overtime. Darwin Cook fouled out.
  26. **Jump up ^** Johnny Moore barely missed a quadruple-double, by one steal.
  27. **Jump up ^** Larry Bird did not play in the fourth quarter due to the Celtics' 22 point lead, as well as his own volition. He barely missed a quadruple-double, by one steal.
  28. **Jump up ^** Micheal Ray Richardson registered a triple-double, and nearly reached a quadruple-double. The game went to triple overtime.
  29. **Jump up ^** Maurice Cheeks had seven steals in a half.
  30. **Jump up ^** T. R. Dunn did not start the game. Teammate [Fat Lever](/wiki/Fat_Lever "Fat Lever") had eight steals in the same game. It is the only time in NBA history that two teammates have both collected eight or more steals in the same game.
  31. **Jump up ^** Michael Jordan had 8 steals in the first half, tying the NBA record.
  32. **Jump up ^** Doc Rivers had seven steals in a half.
  33. **Jump up ^** The game went to overtime.
  34. **Jump up ^** Paul Pierce had six steals in the first quarter and seven steals in the first half.
  35. **Jump up ^** Allen Iverson had seven steals in the second half.
  36. **Jump up ^** Andre Miller had six steals in the second half.
  37. **Jump up ^** The game went to overtime.
  38. **Jump up ^** Rafer Alston had eight steals in the second half, tying the NBA record.
  39. **Jump up ^** Chris Paul had seven steals in the first half.
  40. **Jump up ^** Mario Chalmers was a rookie.
  41. **Jump up ^** John Wall was a rookie. He had seven steals in the second half. The game went to overtime.
  42. **Jump up ^** The game was Michael Carter-Williams' NBA debut, marking the most steals in an NBA debut.
